original: (d)“MSCI Licensed Materials” means collectively, to the extent owned by a member of the MSCI Provider Group, any hardware settings and configurations, generic software libraries and routines, and generic document templates not separately commercialized by the MSCI Provider Group (as defined below) and used by MS prior to the Trigger Date. For the avoidance of doubt, the MSCI Licensed Materials does not include (i) any patent, trademark or service mark of the MSCI Provider Group, (ii) any infrastructure hardware or software (e.g., monitoring software and systems, customized operating systems and middleware), or (iii) any software or data separately licensed to MS by the MSCI Provider Group (such as the Barra Aegis software or the MSCI indices). For the avoidance of doubt, the document templates do not include any references to members of the MSCI Provider Group or its personnel.

(d) "Non-Exclusive MSCI Assets" encompass, with respect to any intellectual property belonging to a member of the MSCI Provider Group, any hardware settings, generic software libraries and routines, as well as document templates that are not individually commercialized by the MSCI Provider Group (as defined herein) and were utilized by MS prior to the Trigger Date. It is important to clarify that the Non-Exclusive MSCI Assets do not comprise (i) any patents, trademarks, or service marks owned by the MSCI Provider Group, (ii) any infrastructure hardware or software (for instance, monitoring tools and systems, customized operating systems, and middleware), or (iii) any software or data licensed to MS by the MSCI Provider Group on a separate basis (such as Barra Aegis software or MSCI indices). For the avoidance of doubt, the document templates do not contain any mention of members of the MSCI Provider Group or their personnel.

In this revised clause, the ownership and scope of the assets have been altered slightly to emphasize non-exclusive usage rights instead of direct ownership by the contracting party. Additionally, the term "MSCI Licensed Materials" has been replaced with "Non-Exclusive MSCI Assets", which better reflects this changed relationship.

original: MS hereby grants (subject to any existing third party contractual obligations) to MSCI a non-exclusive, perpetual, irrevocable, world- wide, royalty-free license for MSCI to use, modify, copy, create derivative works of and sublicense, for any business purpose, the MS Licensed Materials.
modified: Grantor (MS) hereby provides (with the exception of any pre-existing contractual obligations towards third parties), a non-exclusive, revocable, limited in time (until terminated at MS's discretion), world-wide license to Licensee (MSCI). This license permits MSCI to utilize, modify, reproduce, and create derivative works from the Grantee Materials, solely for business purposes. Notably, this license does not grant sublicensing rights to MSCI, except as expressly agreed upon in writing by both parties.

6.MISCELLANEOUS

6.1 Governing Law, Jurisdiction, and Alternative Dispute Resolution Mechanisms

In the event of any dispute or claim arising out of or in connection with this Agreement, the parties shall first endeavor to resolve such dispute through good faith negotiations. If these efforts fail, then either party may initiate binding arbitration under the rules of the International Chamber of Commerce (ICC), with the seat of the arbitration to be held in [City], [Country]. The language of the arbitration shall be English, and the award rendered shall be final and binding upon both parties. This clause shall not preclude either party from seeking temporary or preliminary injunctive relief in a court of competent jurisdiction as necessary to protect its rights pending the completion of the arbitration process.

The governing law of this Agreement shall be the laws of [Country], excluding its conflict of laws principles that would result in the application of the laws of another jurisdiction. Any legal action or proceeding concerning this Agreement may only be brought in a court of competent jurisdiction located in [City], [Country]. Both parties irrevocably submit to the exclusive jurisdiction of such courts and waive any objection to venue laid therein.

6.3 Communication Protocol:

In the event that either Party requires to provide any notices, communications, or other similar formalities under this Agreement, they shall duly notify the other Party in writing or through electronic means. The receiving Party assumes the responsibility for acknowledging receipt of such notification within seven (7) business days and acting promptly thereafter. Failure to do so will not absolve the responsible Party from their obligations under this Agreement.

In the interest of maintaining a harmonious and cooperative business relationship, it is hereby agreed that any disputes arising from this contract shall be resolved amicably through open dialogue, with both parties making reasonable efforts to understand each other's perspectives. If an agreement cannot be reached within a reasonable timeframe, either party may seek the assistance of a mutually agreed-upon third-party mediator for resolution. This clause is intended to minimize potential adversarial proceedings and promote the spirit of partnership embodied in this contract.

This modified clause aims to shift responsibility for dispute resolution towards a collaborative approach and away from potential litigation, emphasizing the importance of maintaining a constructive business relationship.

Any deviation from the terms of this Agreement, whether by modification or waiver, shall only be binding if made in writing and signed by an authorized representative of each party.

Title: Modification of Liability Provisions Regarding Data Breaches

Original Clause: In the event that a data breach occurs, the Company shall promptly notify all affected parties within 72 hours and take immediate steps to rectify the issue. The Company shall also be liable for any damages or losses incurred by the affected parties as a result of the breach, subject to applicable law and regulation.

Rewritten Clause: Should a data breach transpire, the Company will make reasonable efforts to inform all impacted parties within a timely manner, although it may not be possible to adhere strictly to a 72-hour timeframe. The affected parties acknowledge that their recourse for any damages or losses arising from the breach is limited to the extent provided by applicable law and regulation, and the Company shall have no further liability in such cases beyond complying with said legislation.
